glsa.title: Git: Arbitrary command execution
glsa.synopsis: An attacker could execute arbitrary commands via Git repositories in a case-insensitive or case-normalizing filesystem.

background.p: Git is a free and open source distributed version control system designed to handle everything from small to very large projects with speed and efficiency.

description.p: A vulnerability in Git causing Git-compatible clients that access case-insensitive or case-normalizing filesystems to overwrite the .git/config when cloning or checking out a repository, leading to execution of arbitrary commands.

impact.p: An attacker can execute arbitrary commands on a client machine that clones a crafted malicious Git tree.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
